details.title: All you need to know about Ramjanmabhoomi-Babri Masjid case
details.content: The 69-year-old Ramjanmabhoomi-Babri Masjid case will finally come to an end on Saturday with the verdict set to be delivered at 10.30 AM. Outgoing Chief Justice Ranjan Gogoi and four other judges - next CJI designate S A Bobde, Justices D Y Chandrachud, Ashok Bhushan and S A Nazeer - are in the constitution bench which was hearing the case. (READ MORE)

details.title: Not another Babri mosque but peace is what we want, say India's Muslim youth
details.content: Although the scars of the violence the demolition of Babri mosque unleashed are still healing for some, the Muslim youth we reached out to only wished for peace and justice. (READ MORE)

DGP UP OP Singh:Special vigil being maintained on more than 670 persons on social media.If need arises internet can be stopped.Temporary prisons created in every district of state.Special focus on 31 sensitive districts.Section 144 already imposed in UP. #Ayodhya @NewIndianXpress

— Sana Shakil (@sanashakil_TNIE) November 9, 2019

Elaborate security arrangements have been made across the country ahead of the Supreme Court judgement in the communally sensitive Ayodhya land dispute case on Saturday, while the temple town remained on edge and political and religious leaders urged people to maintain peace and respect the verdict. (READ MORE)

details.title: Ayodhya verdict should not be seen as matter of victory or loss: PM Modi
details.content: A day before the Supreme Court is to deliver its landmark verdict on the Ayodhya title dispute, Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday said the judgment "will not be a victory or defeat" for anyone. (READ MORE)

details.title: States appeal for calm, boost security measures
details.content: States have started preparing for the Supreme Court verdict on Ram Janmabhoomi-Babri Masjid title dispute verdict by boosting security and appealing for calm. (READ MORE)

OP Singh, UP DGP said:

  • 40 companies of security forces have been provided by the centre

  • Special vigil is being maintained on more than 670 persons on social media

  • If need arises internet can be stopped

  • Temporary prisons created in every district of UP

  • Special focus on 31 sensitive districts

  • Section 144 already imposed in every district of UP

The 40 days of hearing by CJI Gogoi-led bench witnessed a lot of drama and finally ended on October 16. Here’s a look at the three main parties to the dispute and their main arguments before the apex court. (READ MORE)

details.title: UP police chief says prepared for the big day
details.content: A multi-layered security was put in place in the temple town of Ayodhya, turning it into a fortress with the deployment of 60 companies of PAC and paramilitary forces. Vehicle checking was intensified near the Ramjanmabhoomi site, ‘karyashala’ of Ram Janmabhoomi Nyas and other parts of the town. (READ MORE)

details.title: Security beefed up in Ayodhya
details.content:
• 60 companies of security personals including PAC, CRPF and RAF jawans have been mobilised for Ayodhya

  • 25 companies were already deployed in Ayodhya

  • Apart from this around 1200 constables, 250 Sub inspectors, 11 Additional SP, 20 Dy SP and 2 SP  level officials are already deployed in security

details.title: High Court verdict on three-way division of land failed to settle dispute
details.content: Delivering the verdict, the Bench stated that the portion under the central dome of the demolished three-dome structure, where the idol of Ram Lalla had been kept in a makeshift temple, was the birthplace of Lord Rama “as per faith and belief of the Hindus”. (READ MORE)

details.title: Delhi Police boosts security, warns mischief mongers
details.content: Delhi Police has made elaborate security arrangements in the national capital in view of the expected Supreme Court judgment on the Ayodhya dispute on Saturday, especially around religious sites, an official statement issued on Friday said. (READ MORE)

details.title: Kochi police on its toes to prevent possible violence
details.content: The Kochi city police have taken elaborate measures to prevent any violence in the wake of the Supreme Court verdict in the Ayodhya Ram Mandir case, which is to be announced on Saturday. (READ MORE)

details.title: Karnataka put on high alert, section 144 imposed all across
details.content: Karnataka has been put on “high alert” along with some other states in the country by the Centre in the wake of the impending Supreme Court verdict on the Ayodhya Ram Janmabhoomi-Babri Masjid dispute. (READ MORE)
The Ramjanambhoomi-Babri Masjid dispute in pictures (VIEW GALLERY)

details.title: Section 144 has been imposed in the state of UP
details.content:
Security heightened in #Ayodhya ahead of the verdict in Ayodhya land dispute case today; Section 144 (prohibits assembly of more than 4 people in an area) has been imposed in the state of Uttar Pradesh. pic.twitter.com/XTw8rhTyfm

— ANI (@ANI) November 9, 2019
Rajasthan: Section-144 of CrPC imposed in Jaisalmer, till 30th November 2019, ahead of the Ayodha Verdict.
Punjab CM Captain Amarinder Singh reviews the State’s law and order situation, directs officers to remain on high alert.

details.title: We have full faith in our judiciary: Nitin Gadkari
details.content:
Union Minister Nitin Gadkari: We have full faith in our judiciary. I appeal to all to accept Supreme Court's verdict and maintain peace. #AyodhaVerdict pic.twitter.com/rQNfPs08d1

— ANI (@ANI) November 9, 2019
All schools and colleges in the state to remain closed today: Rajasthan Government
Mobile internet service suspended in Bharatpur till 6 am tomorrow ahead of verdict on Ayodhya land dispute case today: Rajasthan Government

details.title: I appeal to all to respect SC verdict and maintain peace: Mahant Satyendra Das
details.content:
Mahant Satyendra Das, Chief Priest of the makeshift Ram temple in #Ayodhya: I appeal to all to respect the Supreme Court verdict and maintain peace. Prime Minister has rightly said that the Ayodhya verdict will not be anyone’s loss or victory. pic.twitter.com/qCRyLg4ccl

— ANI (@ANI) November 9, 2019

Karnataka State Road Transport Corporation (KSRTC): In view of the Supreme Court verdict, it is directed that all DCs and Divisional officers, Depot Managers be in their Headquarters and have a close liasion with the local police authorities while operating buses. #AyodhyaVerdict

— ANI (@ANI) November 9, 2019

Karnataka State Road Transport Corporation: If any untoward incident happens, the same may be immediately reported to Control Room at Central Office. While operating buses, all are instructed to take extra care and advisory from local police authorities.

Ayodhya: Security deployed in the area around Ram Janmabhoomi police station. Supreme Court will pronounce #AyodhyaVerdict today. pic.twitter.com/d6FsWEjcTh

— ANI UP (@ANINewsUP) November 9, 2019

Ayodhya: Security outside Hanuman Garhi Mandir. Supreme Court will pronounce #AyodhyaVerdict today. pic.twitter.com/pbB3AlM7w2

— ANI UP (@ANINewsUP) November 9, 2019

IG (Moradabad Range), Ramit Sharma: Everything is normal. Instructed security forces & depts to stay alert in morning. We expect everything to be normal. We're monitoring social media so that action can be taken against anyone spreading rumours or hurting people's sentiments.

Sec 144 (prohibits assembly of more than 4 people in an area) hasn't been imposed yet. We're continuously monitoring social media, we'll ensure that rumours aren't spread. Internet services haven't been suspended, further decision will be taken as per situation: PRO Mumbai Police

Pranay Ashok,PRO Mumbai Police: We're taking the situation very seriously. We'll make complete use of the 40,000 strong Mumbai police. We have RCP (Riot Control Police), Law&Order reserves, special forces like SRPF, RAF,they'll be deployed at strategic locations. #AyodhyaVerdict pic.twitter.com/7eTDmdb2Wz

— ANI (@ANI) November 8, 2019

Pranay Ashok, PRO Mumbai Police: More than 5000 cameras are already installed for city surveillance, we will monitor with the help of the feed coming in at our control room. We will also deploy our drone units as per the situation.

Manish Sisodia, Delhi Deputy CM: There are potential security concerns with the SC #AyodhyaVerdict. All government schools and many private schools are closed on Nov 9, as it is a second Saturday. We are advising all private schools to also remain closed on Nov 9. (file pic) pic.twitter.com/6RqhU0ftBT

— ANI (@ANI) November 8, 2019

details.title: Police forces will be deployed everywhere: Aligarh District Magistrate
details.content:
Aligarh District Magistrate (DM), Chandra Bhushan Singh: Police forces will be deployed everywhere. One company of RAF (Rapid Action Force) is here, we have asked for one more company from the govt. All of us are on alert. pic.twitter.com/G19ts3NL3E

— ANI UP (@ANINewsUP) November 8, 2019

Director General (Law&Order), Uttarakhand: Police of all 13 districts instructed to keep a close watch on undesirable elements&on sensitive places. Instructions issued to maintain strict vigil in Dehradun, Haridwar, Udhamsingh Nagar and Nainital. Extra security personnel being deployed

Chief Minister of Kerala, Pinarayi Vijayan on Ayodhya verdict: All of us should ensure that our reactions will be peaceful no matter what the verdict be. It should not create any room for hate mongering. State police has been directed to be on high alert.

details.title: We are appealing to people of UP to not spread rumors on social media: DGP OP Singh
details.content:
Uttar Pradesh Director General of Police (DGP), OP Singh: We have taken confidence building measures, we did around 10,000 meetings across the state with religious leaders & citizens. We are appealing to people of the state to not spread rumors on social media. #AyodhaVerdict pic.twitter.com/sBLZTxvwbQ

— ANI (@ANI) November 9, 2019

UP DGP: Paramilitary forces have been deployed in Ayodhya, aerial surveillance is being done. Intelligence machinery has been geared up, random checks are also taking place. An ADG rank officer has been deployed in Ayodhya to keep an eye on operations.

Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh (RSS) Chief Mohan Bhagwat to address the media at 1 pm today, following Supreme Court judgment in Ayodhya land case. (file pic) pic.twitter.com/Hf9Ce9Go0Y

— ANI (@ANI) November 9, 2019

Delhi: Security personnel outside Supreme Court ahead of verdict in #Ayodhya land case; Section 144 is imposed in the area pic.twitter.com/AAJobFb9KR

— ANI (@ANI) November 9, 2019

details.title: Temporary jails in all UP districts, tight security in Ayodhya ahead of SC verdict
details.content: Security has been beefed up in Ayodhya and adjoining areas ahead of the Supreme Court verdict on the Ram Janmabhoomi-Babri Masjid title suit and the administration is keeping strict vigil in 31 districts of Uttar Pradesh, officials said on Saturday. (READ MORE)

details.title: Himachal police warns against circulation of fake news
details.content: Strict penal action will be taken against those who indulge in the circulation of fake news, morphed pictures, doctored videos or any inflammatory material, said police. (READ MORE)

details.title: Leaders across party lines make plea for peace
details.content: Ahead of the Apex Court verdict in the Ram Janmabhoomi case on Saturday morning, leaders cutting across party lines appealed to people to maintain peace and harmony. They urged their members to ensure peace and harmony, and dissuaded people from falling prey to messages which could be provocative. (READ MORE)

details.title: Muslim outfit in Tamil Nadu promises harmony post SC Ayodhya verdict
details.content: Representatives of the All-India Federation for National Harmony on Friday called on Tamil Nadu CM Edappadi K Palaniswami and promised him that they would cooperate with the State government in maintaining communal harmony after the Supreme Court delivers its final verdict on the Ram Janmabhoomi-Babri Masjid dispute, expected today. (READ MORE)

details.title: Valson Thampu's Opinion: SC verdict - A passage to Ayodhya
details.content: Justice S A Bobde, the Chief Justice of India-designate, holds, quite rightly, the Ayodhya title dispute to be one of the most significant cases in the world. That is because it is much more than a title dispute. Law, as law, deals with all title disputes alike. In that case, this too is only what it purports to be: a title dispute. One title dispute is just like another. None is more significant than the rest. But the Ayodhya dispute is unique and earth-shaking, and it is hypocritical to pretend that it is not. (READ MORE)

details.title: Ahead of Ayodhya verdict, people in Uttar Pradesh's Banda installing CCTV cameras at own expense
details.content: Ahead of the Supreme Court's verdict in the Ram Mandir-Babri Masjid case, people in Uttar Pradesh's Banda district are ensuring the installation of CCTV cameras at every corner. Moreover, they are doing it at their own expense. (READ MORE)

details.title: There is no question of anything going wrong: ID Shukla, Joint CP
details.content:
ID Shukla, Joint CP: Delhi Police has taken appropriate security measures with the help of paramilitary, ahead of the #AyodhyaVerdict. There is no question of any mishappening, be it the security of Supreme Court, High Court or the security of a VIP-VVIP, it cannot be breached. pic.twitter.com/HlsZQV1mn3

— ANI (@ANI) November 9, 2019

ADG (Prosecution) UP Police, Ashutosh Pandey in #Ayodhya: Devotees are visiting the temple of Shri Ram Lalla. There are no restrictions on visiting the temple. All markets are open, the situation is completely normal.

Odisha Chief Minister, Naveen Patnaik: Ahead of #AyodhyaVerdict, appeal to everyone to accept the judgement of the Honourable Supreme Court. Let us continue to live in peace and harmony. The spirit of brotherhood is the hallmark of our secular fabric. (file pic) pic.twitter.com/7YqKYQWY2e

— ANI (@ANI) November 9, 2019

details.title: Congress leaders to meet Saturday morning, ahead of Ayodhya verdict
details.content: Congress top brass would be meeting on Saturday morning to discuss its strategy in the wake of the Ayodhya verdict by the Supreme Court. (READ MORE)

जैसा कि आप सबको पता है, अयोध्या मामले पर आज उच्चतम न्यायालय का फैसला आने वाला है। इस घड़ी में न्यायालय का जो भी निर्णय हो, देश की एकता, सामाजिक सद्भाव, और आपसी प्रेम की हज़ारों साल पुरानी परम्परा को बनाए रखने की ज़िम्मेदारी हम सबकी है । #AYODHYAVERDICT

— Priyanka Gandhi Vadra (@priyankagandhi) November 9, 2019

#WATCH ADG (Prosecution) UP Police, Ashutosh Pandey in #Ayodhya: Devotees are visiting the temple of Shri Ram Lalla. There are no restrictions on visiting the temple. All markets are open, the situation is completely normal. pic.twitter.com/khqSUXPfx5

— ANI (@ANI) November 9, 2019
Internet services to be suspended for 24 hours in Jaipur Commissionerate, from 10 am today: Rajasthan

On Friday, the district administration had issued an advisory asking citizens to stay indoors and keep businesses establishments closed, clamping a lockdown on the city in anticipation of the verdict. Vehicular movement is also restricted in the Ayodhya.
Security has been tightened in sensitive districts such as Meerut, Moradabad, Agra, Aligarh, Prayagraj, Lucknow and Gorakhpur.
The courtroom is already crowded with lawyers connected with the case. The court security officials have also limited the entry to the courtroom.

#AyodhyaVerdict: Security personnel being briefed at Supreme Court premises. Five-judge bench of the Supreme Court to deliver judgement in Ayodhya land case at 1030 am today. pic.twitter.com/o4dmNz1XqY

— ANI (@ANI) November 9, 2019

Ayodhya District Magistrate, Anuj Kumar Jha: Keeping the disputed site safe is our priority, we have made adequate arrangements for it, forces have been deployed in the city. Everything is normal in the city, we will keep an eye on negative elements.

Ahead of Supreme Court’s verdict in the #Ayodhya title suit over 2.77acre disputed land today, unprecedented security arrangements have been made turning Ayodhya into a fortress. #AYODHYAVERDICT #AyodhyaHearing pic.twitter.com/IkT5fhFmJ0

— The New Indian Express (@NewIndianXpress) November 9, 2019

The CWC meeting has been rescheduled to tomorrow 09.11.19, 0945 am at 10 Janpath. CWC members, Permanent Invitees & Special invitees will be attending the meeting.

— K C Venugopal (@kcvenugopalmp) November 8, 2019

Faizabad district administration had issued an advisory asking citizens to stay indoors and keep business establishments closed, clamping a lockdown on the city in anticipation of the #AYODHYAVERDICT. Vehicular movement is also restricted in the city.#AyodhyaHearing pic.twitter.com/tFEhL54gZI

— The New Indian Express (@NewIndianXpress) November 9, 2019

The CWC meeting has been rescheduled to tomorrow 09.11.19, 0945 am at 10 Janpath. CWC members, Permanent Invitees & Special invitees will be attending the meeting.

— K C Venugopal (@kcvenugopalmp) November 8, 2019

details.title: Home Minister Amit Shah calls a high level meeting
details.content: Home Minister Amit Shah calls a high level security meeting at his residence. National Security Advisor (NSA) Ajit Doval, Intelligence Bureau (IB) Chief, Arvind Kumar, and other senior officials to attend the meeting.

details.title: It is imperative that we do not get carried away due to our religious affiliations: Chandrababu Naidu
details.content:
The #AYODHYAVERDICT will be out today. It is imperative that we do not get carried away due to our religious affiliations. Let us all respect the Supreme Court’s judgment and unite to preserve peace and harmony in the society. #BabriMasjid #RamMandir

— N Chandrababu Naidu (@ncbn) November 9, 2019
Rapid action force and Tamilnadu police quick reaction force posted at athupulam and karumbukadai junction in Coimbatore City. (Photo | U Rakesh Kumar, EPS)

details.title: UP Helpline Number
details.content: UP launches WhatsApp helpline number for receiving complaints regarding provocative messages: 8874327341

details.title: CJI Ranjan Gogoi arrives at SC
details.content: The Chief Justice of India Ranjan Gogoi has arrived at the Supreme Court

details.content: (Photo| EPS)

details.title: One minute to the verdict
details.content: Media, lawyers and all stakeholders are currently presently in the courtroom.

details.title: Verdict to be out shortly
details.content: Copy of judgments and judges arrive in courtroom 1

details.title: All eyes on the verdict now
details.content: Uttar Pradesh chief minister Yogi Adityanath is personally monitering the security arrangements from the control room in the state.
The bench has assembled. Copy of judgements arrived. Judges are signing respective copies of the judgement now.
It's an unanimous judgment. Shia Wakf board SLP rejected against Sunni board on claim to Babri Masjid.
Babri mosque was built by Mir Baqi: CJI
CJI Gogoi is reading out the judgment, says it will take about half an hour to read out the judgment.

details.title: Court must accept faith and belief of worshippers: CJI
details.content: Inapparopriate for court to enter into area of theology. This court must accept faith and belief of worshippers: CJI

Nirmohi Akhara suit is barred by limitation, rules SC.
Ramlalla Virajman suit is within limitation period.
The claim of Nirmohi Akhara is only of management. Nirmohi Akhara is not a Shabait, rules Supreme Court.
Ramlalla Virajman is a juristic entity not Janamsthana (Ramjanmbhoomi), rules Supreme Court.
ASI report can't be neglected and is credential beyond doubt: SC
A temple-like structure was under Babri Masjid. The underlying structure is not islamic origin. Title of the land must be decided as per the law, rules SC.
ASI report does not say, temple razed to build masjid: CJI
Title cannot be established on the basis of faith and belief: CJI
There is clear evidence the Hindus believed Ram was born in the disputed site: CJI
Mere evidence of structure not enough to lay claims: CJI
SC holds the suit by Sunni Waqf Board to be within limitation but they can't assert right to adverse possession: CJI
Both Hindus and Muslims offered prayers inside the inner courtyard while the same was done by Hindus in the outer courtyard: CJI

details.title: RAF deployed at Charminar in Hyderabad
details.content:
RAF deployed at Charminar in #Hyderabad on Saturday on account of #AYODHYAVERDICT#AyodhyaHearing

Reported by @meetsenbaga@NewIndianXpress pic.twitter.com/criXb8MJh8

— TNIE Telangana (@XpressHyderabad) November 9, 2019
Babri Masjid was never abandoned by the Muslims: SC
Maharashtra: Section 144 of CrPC imposed in Mumbai city till 11 am tomorrow
Muslims could not prove possessory title. No evidence of offering namaz till British period: SC
Evidence of belief that Ram's birthplace inside structure, says SC

details.title: Key points from the verdict so far

details.content: Rajasthan: Section-144 of CrPC imposed in Sri Ganganagar, till 19th November 2019
Placing of idols inside mosque in 1949 amounts to desecration and demolition is against the court order, holds SC
Allahabad high court was wrong in dividing the site into three parts: SC
SC directs allotment of alternate land to Muslims.
Centre given three months to set up a trust under Ayodhya Act. Possession of the land to be given to the trust, rules SC.
SC directs government to allot 5 acres of land to Sunni Waqf Board to build a mosque.
Internet services temporarily suspended in Rajasthan's Ajmer till 6 am tomorrow.
SC rules possession of inner and outer courtyard to be handed over to the trust which will have a representative from Nirmohi Akhara.
SC rules possession of inner and outer courtyard to be handed over to the trust which will have a representative from Nirmohi Akhara.

The right of Ram Lalla to the disputed property is subject to the maintenance of peace and law and order and tranquility. Government to take measures for maintaining peace and harmony and law and order.

SC orders that Central Government within 3-4 months formulate scheme for setting up of trust and hand over the disputed site to it for construction of temple at the site and a suitable alternative plot of land measuring 5 acres at Ayodhya will be given to Sunni Wakf Board.
Vishnu Shankar Jain, Hindu Mahasabha Lawyer: Supreme Court has said, 'to give 5 acres alternate land to Muslims at a prominent place in Ayodhya.'

Group of lawyers raise Jai Sri Ram slogans in Supreme Court premises, they were later asked to stop by other lawyers. #AyodhyaJudgment pic.twitter.com/L0QIiUir9z

— ANI (@ANI) November 9, 2019
Varun Kumar Sinha, Lawyer of Hindu Mahasabha: It is a historic judgement. With this judgement, the Supreme Court has given the message of unity in diversity.

details.title: Amit Shah reviews security situation across India
details.content: Union Home Minister Amit Shah reviewed the security situation in the country as the Supreme Court began delivering its judgment on the Ram Janmabhoomi-Babri Masjid title suit. (READ MORE)
"It is a historic judgment. With this judgment, the Supreme Court has given the message of unity in diversity," says Varun Kumar Sinha, Lawyer of Hindu Mahasabha.

details.title: SC dismisses Shia Waqf Board's appeal, says land belongs to Centre
details.content: The Supreme Court on Saturday dismissed the appeal of the Shia Waqf Board in the politically sensitive Ram Janmbhoomi-Babri Masjid land dispute case in Ayodhya and held that the land belongs to the government as per revenue records. (READ MORE)

details.title: DM Ayodhya congratulates on a 'peaceful resolution'
details.content:
Congratulations everybody on a peaceful resolution of a longstanding dispute. I will urge everybody to observe restraint in celebrating the verdict. Any inciting or insulting behaviour will be acted against.

— Anuj K Jha (@anujias09) November 9, 2019

details.title: Security scaled in Mumbai, 40,000 police personnel deployed
details.content: At least 40,000 police personnel have been deployed in Mumbai in view of the Supreme Court's verdict on the sensitive Ram Janmabhoomi-Babri Masjid suit, which will be delivered on Saturday. (READ MORE)
Security beefed up at Ajmer Sharif Dargah
Zafaryab Jilani, Sunni Waqf Board Lawyer: We respect the judgement but we are not satisfied, we will decide further course of action.

details.title: 'Several contradictions in the verdict'
details.content: "We are not satisfied with the judgment. Several contradictions in the judgment. We will study it and decide the future course of action," says Zafaryab Jilani, the senior advocate has represented the “Muslim side” in the Babri Masjid-Ram Janmabhoomi title case.

details.title: WATCH: Temple-like structure was under the mosque, says SC

details.content: Security tightened across the country (VIEW GALLERY)

details.title: Everyone must accept the SC judgement:  Nitin Gadkari
details.content: Everyone must accept the Supreme Court judgement and maintain peace: Union Minister Nitin Gadkari on Ayodhya Judgment

details.title: SC judgement will be beneficial for the social harmony: Nitish Kumar
details.content: Supreme Court's judgement should be welcomed by everyone, it will be beneficial for the social harmony. There should be no further dispute on this issue, that is my appeal to the people: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar on Ayodhy Verdict

details.title: I respect the judgement of SC: Iqbal Ansari
details.content:
Iqbal Ansari, one of the litigants in Ayodhya case: I am happy that Supreme Court has finally delivered a verdict, I respect the judgement of the court. #AyodhyaJudgment pic.twitter.com/xNlCsguI2b

— ANI (@ANI) November 9, 2019

Kartik Chopra, spokesperson, Nirmohi Akhara: Nirmohi Akhara is grateful that SC has recognised our fight of last 150 years and has given the Nirmohi Akhara adequate representation in the trust to be set up by the Central Government to build & manage the Shri Ram Janmasthan Temple

details.title: Appeal to public to maintain peace: Rajnath Singh
details.content: It is a landmark judgement. Appeal to public to maintain peace and calm: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh on Ayodhya Judgment

details.title: Ayodhya land dispute case ruled in favour of Hindus, Muslims given alternate plot for mosque
details.content: In a landmark ruling, the Supreme Court of India overturned the Allahabad High Court order for the partition of the disputed land and directed that the land must be given to Hindus for construction of temple through a government-monitored trust and Muslims must be given an alternate land. (READ MORE)

details.title: Will seek review of verdict: Zafaryab Jilani
details.content: "We will seek review of the verdict," says Zafaryab Jilani, the senior advocate has represented the Muslim side in the Babri Masjid-Ram Janmabhoomi title case.

details.title: Judgement is not satisfactory: Zafaryab Jilani
details.content: Zafaryab Jilani, All India Muslim Personal Law Board: Respect the verdict but the judgement is not satisfactory. There should be no demonstration of any kind anywhere on it.

details.title: WATCH | Landmark judgement, says Rajnath Singh
details.content:
#WATCH "It is a historic and landmark judgement," says Defence Minister Rajnath Singh on #AyodhyaJudgment pic.twitter.com/0hKNBV79Co

— ANI (@ANI) November 9, 2019
Shopkeeper and neighbour greet each other in Hubballi market after Ayodhya verdict.

details.title: We will file a review petition if our committee agrees: Zafaryab Jilani
details.content: We will file a review petition if our committee agrees on it. It is our right and it is in Supreme Court's rules as well: Zafaryab Jilani, All India Muslim Personal Law Board

Supreme Court advocate Anas Tanvir said, "We have always stated that we will accept the judgment come what may.However personally I believe we should not accept the land and I'm sure review will be filed."

details.title: The verdict closed the doors for BJP and others to politicise the issue: Congress
details.content: Randeep Surjewala, Congress on Ayodhya Verdict: Supreme Court's verdict has come, we are in favour of the construction of Ram Temple. This judgement not only opened the doors for the temple's construction but also closed the doors for BJP and others to politicise the issue.

details.title: Tight vigil across Kerala
details.content: Police are maintaining tight vigil across Kerala in the wake of the Ayodhya verdict. Airports, railway stations and other public places are under surveillance.

⚡️In a unanimous judgment, SC ruled that the disputed #Ayodhya land be given to Hindus while directing Centre to allot an alternate land to Sunni Waqf Board to build a mosque.
Read #AYODHYAVERDICT: https://t.co/SKn8GdJGcJ
#AyodhyaJudgment #RamMandir https://t.co/I5HZqHgmHz

— The New Indian Express (@NewIndianXpress) November 9, 2019

details.title: Maintain calm: District Collectors of Kasaragod and Malappuram
details.content: District Collectors of Kasaragod and Malappuram have asked the people to maintain calm. Prohibitory orders under the limits of five police stations in Kasaragod will be in effect till November 11 midnight.

details.title: Prior police sanction mandatory for all types of rallies: Malappuram Collector
details.content: Malappuram Collector has issued an order which says prior police sanction mandatory for all types of rallies and processions in the district.
Mahant Dharam Das of the Nirwani Akhara arrives at Supreme Court in New Delhi on Saturday. (Photo | Arun Kumar, EPS)

details.title: It is the responsibility of each one of us to reaffirm our tradition of mutual respect: CWC
details.content:
It is the responsibility of each one of us to reaffirm our tradition of mutual respect and unity among all that has defined our society through the ages: CWC @NewIndianXpress

— richa sharma (@richa_TNIE) November 9, 2019

details.title: We respect, accept Ayodhya verdict, says Ajmer Dargah
details.content: The spiritual head of Ajmer dargah on Saturday welcomed the decision of the Supreme Court on Ayodhya case and appealed to people to maintain peace and harmony. (READ MORE)

details.title: Arvind Kejriwal welcomes SC verdict in Ayodhya case, appeals for peace
details.content: Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal on Saturday welcomed the Supreme Court verdict in the Ram Janmbhoomi-Babri Masjid land dispute case, saying the judgement ended the decades-old dispute and appealed to people to maintain peace and harmony. (READ MORE)

details.title: All police stations across Bengal put on high alert
details.content: West Bengal government has put all the police stations on high alert in view of the Supreme Courts verdict in Ayodhya case on Saturday, a senior official said. (READ MORE)

details.title: Ayodhya verdict on Babri Masjid-Ram Janmabhoomi land dispute case | Full text of Supreme Court judgment
Sunni Waqf Board 'dissatisfied' with Ayodhya verdict, to file review petition
details.content: Expressing its dissatisfaction with the Supreme Court verdict that cleared the way for the construction of a Ram Temple at the disputed site in Ayodhya, the Sunni Waqf Board said on Saturday that it will seek a review of the judgment. (READ MORE)

details.title: Jagan appeals people to maintain restraint, security beefed up across Andhra
details.content: Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister YS Jagan Mohan Reddy appealed people of the state to maintain restraint in the wake of the Supreme Court’s verdict on Ayodhya on Sunday. (READ MORE)

details.title: No regret over SC saying Nirmohi Akhara not 'shebait' of deity Ram Lalla: Outfit
details.content: The Nirmohi Akhara has no regrets over the Supreme Court saying that it is not a 'shebait' of deity Ram Lalla, a member of the outfit said after the Ayodhya verdict on Saturday. (READ MORE)

details.title: 'Be committed to maintaining peace': Kerala CM after Ayodhya verdict
details.content: Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan has warned against attempts to disrupt peace and harmony in the society in the wake of the Ayodhya verdict. (READ MORE)

details.title: 'Saddened by the insensitivity shown at joyous occasion like Kartarpur': Qureshi questions timing of Ayodhya verdict
details.content: Pakistan Foreign Minister Shah Mahmood Qureshi on Saturday objected to the timing of the Ayodhya verdict, which coincides with the inauguration of the Kartarpur corridor, saying he was "deeply saddened" at the "insensitivity" shown at such a joyous occasion. (READ MORE)

details.title: It is exactly the kind of decision that we all wanted: KK Muhammed
details.content: KK Muhammed, former regional director (North), Archaeological Survey of India (ASI): I feel vindicated (he had said Ram temple existed before Babri mosque in Ayodhya), I was hounded by a group of people. It is exactly the kind of decision that we all wanted.

details.title: Decision to allot alternate land to Muslim side is welcome: Baba Ramdev
details.content: Baba Ramdev: This is a historic verdict. A grand Ram temple will be built. Decision to allot alternate land to Muslim side is welcome, I believe Hindu brothers should help in the construction of the Masjid as well.

details.title: It's time to strengthen the spirit of bhakti:  PM Narendra Modi
details.content: SC verdict on the Ayodhya land dispute should not be seen as anybody’s win or loss, and appealed to countrymen for peace, unity and amity: PM Narendra Modi

details.title: Be it Ramabhakti or Rahimabhakti, this is the time for all of us to strengthen the spirit of Bhakti: PM Narendra Modi
details.content: "This decision of the Supreme Court is important for several reasons: It shows how important is to follow the legal process in resolving a dispute. Each side was given enough time and opportunity to present its arguments. The temple of justice resolved the decades-old case amicably....This decision should not be seen as a victory or defeat of anyone. Be it Ramabhakti or Rahimabhakti, this is the time for all of us to strengthen the spirit of Bhakti," PM Narendra Modi said.

details.title: We wanted justice not 5 acres of land: Owaisi
details.content: Indian Muslims have faced injustice, but we are not that downtrodden that we cannot manage 5 acres of land for building a mosque. The judgement was awaited because we were fighting for justice. If I wanted a 5 acre of land, I could have begged for the same in the streets of Hyderabad," said AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi.

details.title: Will keep on telling my future generations about what happened on December 6: Asaduddin Owaisi
details.content: I agree with the AIPMLB's statement that we are not satisfied with the verdict. The AIPMLB will take a call on whether to review the decision or not. The Supreme Court maybe Supreme but it is not infallible. It was reiterated by Justice JS Verma, whom the RSS respect a lot. I will keep on telling my future generations about what happened on December 6. Do I not have the right to say that I am not satisfied with the verdict? I am doing contempt? What will now happen to the criminal cases against LK Advani, who the govt now has given Padmashree: Asaduddian Owaisi

details.title: Uma Bharti hails LK Advani for his role in 'Ram Janmabhoomi movement'
details.content: (Photo| Express)

details.title: Odisha govt directs DCs & SPs to remain on high alert
details.content: Odisha Chief Secretary A K Tripathy on Saturday instructed the District Collectors and Superintendents of Police to ensure maintenance of peace and harmony across the state.

details.title: Uma Bharti hails LK Advani for his role in 'Ram Janmabhoomi movement'
details.content: The former Union minister, who was a key figure herself in the saffron agitation, said Advani's devotion to temple cause is at the root of the BJP's success and it is coming back to power for another term. (FULL REPORT)

details.title: Ram Temple must be constructed at the earliest: Raj Thackeray
details.content: (Photo| ANI Twitter)

details.title: Internet services suspended in Aligarh
details.content: Internet services have been suspended here for 24 hours beginning 12 AM on Saturday in view of the Supreme Court's verdict in the Ayodhya land dispute case.

details.title: We must respect SC's judgement and maintain harmony, says Rahul Gandhi
details.content:
सुप्रीम कोर्ट ने अयोध्या मुद्दे पर अपना फैसला सुना दिया है। कोर्ट के इस फैसले का सम्मान करते हुए हम सब को आपसी सद्भाव बनाए रखना है। ये वक्त हम सभी भारतीयों के बीच बन्धुत्व,विश्वास और प्रेम का है।

#AyodhyaVerdict

— Rahul Gandhi (@RahulGandhi) November 9, 2019

details.title: Ayodhya, Ram Mandir dominates Twitter trends worldwide
details.content: Soon after Supreme Court pronounced its verdict in the Ayodhya title dispute; several hashtags like 'HinduMuslimBhaiBhai' and 'AyodhyaVerdict' were seen among the top trends on Twitter in India and worldwide on Saturday. (READ HERE)

details.title: WATCH| We respect the SC verdict and appeal to all to abide by it, says Ashok Gehlot
details.content:
We respect the Supreme Court verdict and appeal to all to abide by it. We must remain united and uphold the values of fraternity and brotherhood that define our nation.
#AyodhyaVerdict pic.twitter.com/c98eCOhZoa

— Ashok Gehlot (@ashokgehlot51) November 9, 2019

details.title: Communities come together to celebrate Ayodhya verdict
details.content: Members of Mumbai Dabbawala Association greet Bohra Community members in South Mumbai. (Photo| EPS)

details.title: CJI Ranjan Gogoi to take out the Ayodhya bench for dinner tonight
details.content: Chief Justice Ranjan Gogoi has planned a dinner with the four judges on the Ayodhya bench - Chief Justice-designate SA Bobde, Justice Ashok Bhushan, Justice DY Chandrachud and Justice SA Nazeer - at Taj Mansingh in the capital on Saturday.

details.title: Udhhav Thackeray to visit Ayodhya on November 24
details.content: "Today's day will be written in golden letters in the history of India. Everyone has accepted the verdict. I will be going to Ayodhya on 24 November," said Shiv Sena chief Uddhav Thackeray.

details.title: Uttar Pradesh Sunni Central Waqf Board not to file review petition
details.content: "We welcome and humbly accept the verdict of the Supreme Court. I want to make it clear that UP Sunni Waqf Board will not go for any review of the SC order or file any curative petition," says Zafar Farooqui, Chairman of Uttar Pradesh Sunni Central Waqf Board.

details.title: Don't agree with filing review petition: Syed Ahmed Bukhari
details.content:
Shahi Imam of Delhi's Jama Masjid Syed Ahmed Bukhari on #AyodhyaJudgment: We have always maintained that we will accept the verdict of Supreme Court. I hope the country will move towards development. As far as filing a review petition is concerned, I don't agree with it. pic.twitter.com/XfS8T25NhH

— ANI (@ANI) November 9, 2019

details.title: No untoward incident reported from anywhere in UP: DGP
details.content: "There is no report of any untoward incident from anywhere in the state. We are keeping a close watch (on the law and order situation). Our team is on the job," UP Director General of Police OP Singh said.

details.title: Some people have no trust in judiciary: Naqvi on Owaisi's remarks
details.content: Minority Affairs Minister Mukhtar Abbas Naqvi slammed the AIMIM chief saying that some people are suffering "from the disease of Talibani mindset". Owaisi on Saturday said the Supreme court verdict on the Ram Janmbhoomi-Babri Masjid land dispute case was a "victory of belief over facts." (READ HERE)
An organisation of 21 indigenous Muslim communities of Assam will offer Rs.5 lakh for the construction of Ram Mandir at Ayodhya.

details.title: Two people booked in Kerala for posting inflammatory Facebook messages
details.content: Detecting the comments on the Facebook page of another person who is followed by over 35,000 people, the cyber wing forwarded the details to S Vijayasankar, the Station House Officer of Ernakulam Central police station, for taking legal action against the duo.
Prime Minister Narendra Modi will address the nation at 6 PM

details.title: Uddhav Thackeray to visit Ayodhya on Nov 24
details.content:
Shiv Sena chief Uddhav Thackeray: Today's day will be written in golden letters in the history of India. Everyone has accepted the verdict. I will be going to Ayodhya on 24 November. #AyodhyaVerdict pic.twitter.com/SzYGSdw0Rm

— ANI (@ANI) November 9, 2019

details.title: Verdict shouldn't be seen as a victory for any litigant
details.content: In a statement, the CPM said while the judgment had provided a judicial resolution to this fractious issue, there are certain premises of the judgment which are "questionable". The CPI maintained that the apex court had delivered a "reconciliatory" judgment. (READ MORE)

details.title: WATCH | PM Narendra Modi addresses the nation
details.content:
WATCH: PM Narendra Modi addresses the nation https://t.co/1zAC3Y4NnK

— ANI (@ANI) November 9, 2019
Today is the day to forget any bitterness one may have; no place for fear, bitterness and negativity in new India, PM Modi siad.
The Supreme Court verdict has brought a new dawn. Now, the next generation will build new India, the Prime Minister added.
